dt: {bc}a philosophical or critical method which asserts that meanings, metaphysical constructs, and hierarchical oppositions (as between key terms in a philosophical or literary work) are always rendered unstable by their dependence on ultimately arbitrary signifiers
{bc}an instance of the use of this method

dt.t: a {wi}deconstruction{/wi} of the nature–culture opposition in Rousseau's work

dt: {bc}the analytic examination of something (such as a theory) often in order to reveal its inadequacy

shortdef: a philosophical or critical method which asserts that meanings, metaphysical constructs, and hierarchical oppositions (as between key terms in a philosophical or literary work) are always rendered unstable by their dependence on ultimately arbitrary signifiers; also : an instance of the use of this method
the analytic examination of something (such as a theory) often in order to reveal its inadequacy

dt: {bc}to examine (something, such as a work of literature) using the methods of {a_link|deconstruction}
{bc}to take apart or examine (something) in order to reveal the basis or composition often with the intention of exposing biases, flaws, or inconsistencies

dt.t: {wi}deconstruct{/wi} the myths of both the left and the right

dt: {bc}to adapt or separate the elements of for use in an ironic or radically new way

dt.t: uses his masterly tailoring skills to {wi}deconstruct{/wi} the classics

shortdef: to examine (something, such as a work of literature) using the methods of deconstruction
to take apart or examine (something) in order to reveal the basis or composition often with the intention of exposing biases, flaws, or inconsistencies
to adapt or separate the elements of for use in an ironic or radically new way
